This Sign hangs outside most banks, though unlike in past versions of the game, it is not even examinable. Instead of a traditional sign with words on it, bank signs are a 3D representation of a bank chest. Some of the sign's variants can be examined if standing on the upper floor.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
3 June 2021
(update)

The bank sign in the Clan Hall no longer blocks line-of-sight, so you can cast the telegrab spell through it.

11 October 2018
(update)

Banks renamed from "Bank of RuneScape" to "Bank of Gielinor". Remaining versions of this sign that still had examine texts changed to "The Bank of Gielinor."

1 January 2004
(update)

Examine text changed to "The bank of Runescape." during the RS2 beta.

24 January 2002
(update)

Examine text changed to "The Bank of runescape"

23 January 2001
(update)

Added to the game, with examine text "The Bank of Varrock"

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The unexaminable version of this Sign still reuses 3D assets designed in the year 2000. The frame is identical to the one used for signs when RuneScape released on 4 January 2001, and the chest hanging underneath is a grayscale version of the chests found in RuneScape Classic, also found on release.
  • The unused variant of this Sign was likely intended for use in the Seers' Village graphical redesign on 24 July 2007, given its addition to the game cache at the same time. However, even after the Seers' redesign, two of the original bank signs remained out front of its bank[1]. This would change when the Rooftop Agility Courses were added in December 2013, at which point only the east sign was replaced with a graphically updated agility obstacle version.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u8Q0duHIWfE&t=119s

This '''Sign''' hangs outside most banks, though unlike in past versions of the game, it is not even examinable. Instead of a traditional sign with words on it, bank signs are a 3D representation of a bank chest. Some of the sign's variants can be examined if standing on the upper floor.

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 3 June 2021
|update = Theatre of Blood: New Modes
|change = The bank sign in the Clan Hall no longer blocks line-of-sight, so you can cast the telegrab spell through it.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 11 October 2018
|update = Spellbook Rework, Wise Old Man and, Increased Zoom
|change = Banks renamed from "Bank of RuneScape" to "Bank of Gielinor". Remaining versions of this sign that still had examine texts changed to "The Bank of Gielinor." 
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 1 January 2004
|update = None
|change = Examine text changed to "The bank of Runescape." during the RS2 beta.
}}
{{Subject changes

|change = Examine text changed to "The Bank of runescape"
}}

}}
{{Subject changes footer}}

==Trivia==
*The unexaminable version of this Sign still reuses 3D assets designed in the year 2000. The frame is identical to the one used for signs when ''RuneScape'' released on [[4 January]] [[2001]], and the chest hanging underneath is a grayscale version of the chests found in ''RuneScape Classic'', also found on release.
*The unused variant of this Sign was likely intended for use in the [[Seers' Village]] graphical redesign on [[24 July]] [[2007]], given its addition to the game cache at the same time. However, even after the Seers' redesign, two of the original bank signs remained out front of its bank<ref>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u8Q0duHIWfE&t=119s</ref>. This would change when the [[Rooftop Agility Courses]] were added in December 2013, at which point only the east sign was replaced with a graphically updated agility obstacle version.
